insights.populationGrowth: Stable population with 0.8% annual growth, balanced by outmigration to urban centers and climate-driven movement patterns.
insights.educationLevel: Moderate education levels with 78% literacy, challenges in remote areas with nomadic populations accessing education services.
insights.employmentPattern: Livestock herding dominates (55%), agriculture 15%, mining 12%, services 10%, government 8%. Seasonal employment patterns follow traditional nomadic cycles.
insights.housingPattern: Mix of traditional gers (40%), permanent houses (35%), and seasonal camps (25%). Climate adaptation influences housing choices and mobility patterns.

sources: Ministry of Food, Agriculture and Light Industry

insights.temperature: Extreme continental climate with harsh winters reaching -35째C and hot summers up to 35째C. Located at 1,405m elevation with high temperature variability.
insights.precipitation: Low annual precipitation of 150mm concentrated in summer months. High evaporation rates and frequent drought conditions affect pastoral activities.
insights.seasonality: Four extreme seasons: brutal winter (November-March) with dzud risk, brief spring (April-May) with dust storms, warm summer (June-August) with most precipitation, short autumn (September-October).
insights.extremeEvents: Severe dzud (winter disaster) events, intense dust storms, summer droughts, and flash floods from sudden snowmelt affecting traditional herding patterns.

vulnerabilities.infrastructure: Sparse infrastructure, limited communication networks, isolated settlements
